title-part.text: FERMENTATION OR ENZYME-USING PROCESSES TO SYNTHESISE A DESIRED CHEMICAL COMPOUND OR COMPOSITION OR TO SEPARATE OPTICAL ISOMERS FROM A RACEMIC MIXTURE

reference.text: brewing of beer C12C; producing vinegar C12J; producing specific peptides or proteins C07K; producing enzymes C12N9/00; DNA or RNA concerning genetic engineering, vectors, e.g. plasmids, or their isolation, preparation or purification C12N15/00; measuring or testing processes involving enzymes or microorganisms C12Q; measuring or testing processes involving nucleic acid amplification reactions C12Q1/6844; fermentation processes to form a food composition, A21 or A23; compounds in general, see the relevant compound class, e.g. C01, C07

note.note-paragraph: This subclass covers the production of compounds or compositions by biochemical transformation of matter performed by using enzymes or microorganisms, wherein microorganisms are defined as any single-celled organisms, including bacteria, fungi, yeast or microalgae, or plant or mammalian cells in the form of cell cultures.

In this subclass, documents are primarily classified according to the compounds produced. In addition, if appropriate, classification according to the method or biocatalyst used to produce the compound is made.
Classification in groups C12P19/14 - C12P19/24, C12P39/00, C12P41/00 - C12P41/009 should only be made together with the corresponding product groups

The following IPC groups are not in the CPC scheme. The subject matter for these IPC groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
- C12P21/04 covered by C07K7/50
- C12P21/08 covered by C07K16/00
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Preparation of compounds or compositions, not provided for in groups C12P3/00 - C12P39/00, by using microorganisms or enzymes

note.note-paragraph: This group is used for the classification of documents relating to the production of compounds of unknown structure
When classifying in this group, classification should be made also in C12R

reference.text: recovery of carbon dioxides as by-products C12F3/02

CPC-specific-text.text: or halogenated hydrocarbons
cyclic

reference.text: compounds containing at least three condensed carbocyclic rings C12P15/00

containing one or more isoprene units, i.e. terpenes

Unsaturated compounds, i.e. alkenes, alkynes or allenes

substrate containing sulfite waste liquor or citrus waste
Multiple types of microorganisms or re-use of microorganisms

produced from substrate containing protein as nitrogen source
produced from substrate containing grain or cereal material

title-part.text: Dicarboxylic acids having four or less carbon atoms, e.g. fumaric acid, maleic acid

title-part.text: Higher fatty acids, i.e. having at least seven carbon atoms in an unbroken chain bound to a carboxyl group

by hydrolysis of Fatty acid esters
Polyunsaturated fatty acids [PUFA], i.e. having 2 or more double bonds in their backbone
Fatty acid esters
Glycerides
by esterification
obtained from glyceride producing microorganisms, e.g. single cell oil
containing polyunsaturated fatty acid [PUFA] residues, i.e. having 2 or more double bonds in their backbone
Phosphoglycerides

reference.text: phosphoglycerides having carboxylic acids with less than 7 carbon atoms, C12P7/62

CPC-specific-text.text: Biodiesel, i.e. Fatty acid alkyl esters

title-part.text: Preparation of organic compounds containing a metal or atom other than H, N, C, O, S or halogen

CPC-specific-text.text: Amines; Imines
Nitriles (-CN)
Cyanohydrins
Amino acids other than alpha- or beta amino acids, e.g. gamma amino acids
Carnitine; Butyrobetaine; Crotonobetaine
containing a N-O bond, e.g. nitro (-NO2), nitroso (-NO)
or polyamides; Imides or polyimides; Urethanes, i.e. compounds comprising N-C=O structural element or polyurethanes

title-part.text: using surfactants, fatty acids or fatty acid esters, i.e. having at least seven carbon atoms in an unbroken chain bound to a carboxyl group or a carboxyl ester group

note.note-paragraph: Processes for the preparation of different amino acids covered by more than one of the groups C12P13/222 - C12P13/227 are classified in group C12P13/22

CPC-specific-text.text: Phenylalanine
Tyrosine; 3,4-Dihydroxyphenylalanine
Tryptophan

title-part.text: Preparation of compounds containing at least three condensed carbocyclic rings
Preparation of heterocyclic carbon compounds with only O, N, S, Se or Te as ring hetero atoms
Oxygen as only ring hetero atoms
containing a five-membered hetero ring, e.g. griseofulvin

CPC-specific-text.text: , vitamin C

title-part.text: containing a six-membered hetero ring, e.g. fluorescein
containing a hetero ring of at least seven ring members, e.g. zearalenone, macrolide aglycons
Nitrogen as only ring hetero atom
Nitrogen or oxygen as hetero atom and at least one other diverse hetero ring atom in the same ring
containing two or more hetero rings

reference.text: thiamine open chain analogs C12P17/167, i.e. not condensed among themselves or through a common carbocyclic ring system

CPC-specific-text.text: Heterorings having oxygen atoms as the only ring heteroatoms, e.g. Lasalocid
Heterorings having nitrogen atoms as the only ring heteroatoms
Heterorings having sulfur atoms as ring heteroatoms, e.g. vitamin B1, thiamine nucleus and open chain analogs

title-part.text: containing at least two hetero rings condensed among themselves or condensed with a common carbocyclic ring system, e.g. rifamycin

CPC-specific-text.text: Heterocyclic compounds containing oxygen atoms as the only ring heteroatoms in the condensed system, e.g. Salinomycin, Septamycin
Heterocyclic compounds containing nitrogen atoms as the only ring heteroatoms in the condensed system

reference.text: alloxazine or isoalloxazine, e.g. riboflavine C12P25/00

containing a beta-lactam ring, e.g. thienamycin
Heterocyclic compounds containing sulfur atoms as ring hetero atoms in the condensed system

reference.text: cepam nucleus C12P35/00; penam nucleus C12P37/00

containing two or more directly linked sulfur atoms, e.g. epithiopiperazines
Heterocyclic compound containing in the condensed system at least one hetero ring having nitrogen atoms and oxygen atoms as the only ring heteroatoms
containing the rifamycin nucleus

title-part.text: Preparation of compounds containing saccharide radicals

note.note-paragraph: Attention is drawn to the term "saccharide radical" in the first Note following the title of subclass C07H.

title-part.text: Polysaccharides, i.e. compounds containing more than five saccharide radicals attached to each other by glycosidic bonds
produced by the action of a carbohydrase

CPC-specific-text.text: , e.g. by cellulase, hemicellulase

title-part.text: produced by the action of an alpha-1, 6-glucosidase, e.g. amylose, debranched amylopectin
produced by the action of a glycosyl transferase, e.g. alpha-, beta- or gamma-cyclodextrins
produced by the action of an exo-1,4 alpha-glucosidase, e.g. dextrose
produced by the action of a beta-amylase, e.g. maltose
produced by the action of an isomerase, e.g. fructose

CPC-specific-text.text: Pyrimidine nucleotides

title-part.text: having a condensed ring system containing a six-membered ring having two N-atoms in the same ring, e.g. purine nucleotides, nicotineamide-adenine dinucleotide

CPC-specific-text.text: Pyrimidine nucleosides

title-part.text: having a condensed ring system containing a six-membered ring having two nitrogen atoms in the same ring, e.g. purine nucleosides
Cobalamins, i.e. vitamin B12, LLD factor

reference.text: polysaccharides and not substituted disaccharides C12P19/04, C12P19/12

CPC-specific-text.text: The saccharide radical is condensed with a heterocyclic radical, e.g. everninomycin, papulacandin

title-part.text: having an oxygen atom of the saccharide radical bound to a cyclohexyl radical, e.g. kasugamycin
the cyclohexyl radical being substituted by two or more nitrogen atoms, e.g. destomycin, neamin

CPC-specific-text.text: Having two saccharide radicals bound through only oxygen to non-adjacent ring carbons of the cyclohexyl radical, e.g. gentamycin, kanamycin, sisomycin, verdamycin, mutamycin, tobramycin, nebramycin, antibiotics 66-40B, 66-40D, XK-62-2, 66-40, G-418, G-52

title-part.text: having two saccharide radicals bound through only oxygen to adjacent ring carbon atoms of the cyclohexyl radical, e.g. ambutyrosin, ribostamycin
containing three or more saccharide radicals, e.g. neomycin, lividomycin
the cyclohexyl radical being bound directly to a nitrogen atom of two or more radicals, e.g. streptomycin
having an oxygen atom of the saccharide radical directly bound to a condensed ring system having three or more carbocyclic rings, e.g. daunomycin, adriamycin
having an oxygen atom of the saccharide radical directly bound through only acyclic carbon atoms to a non-saccharide heterocyclic ring, e.g. bleomycin, phleomycin
having an oxygen of the saccharide radical directly bound to a non-saccharide heterocyclic ring or a condensed ring system containing a non-saccharide heterocyclic ring, e.g. coumermycin, novobiocin

CPC-specific-text.text: to a 1-benzopyran-2-on (or the chalcones and hydrogenated chalcones thereof, e.g. coumermycin, novobiocin, novenamin)

title-part.text: the hetero ring having eight or more ring members and only oxygen as ring hetero atoms, e.g. erythromycin, spiramycin, nystatin

CPC-specific-text.text: Avermectin; Milbemycin; Ivermectin; C-076
Natamycin; Pimaricin; Tennecetin
Glycopeptides, glycoproteins

title-part.text: having a known sequence of two or more amino acids, e.g. glutathione
produced by the hydrolysis of a peptide bond, e.g. hydrolysate products

reference.text: preparing foodstuffs by protein hydrolysis A23J3/00

title-part.text: Preparation of compounds containing a cyclohexene ring having an unsaturated side chain containing at least ten carbon atoms bound by conjugated double bonds, e.g. carotenes
Preparation of compounds containing alloxazine or isoalloxazine nucleus, e.g. riboflavin
Preparation of compounds containing a gibbane ring system, e.g. gibberellin
Preparation of compounds containing a naphthacene ring system, e.g. tetracycline

Preparation of compounds containing a five-membered ring having two side-chains in ortho position to each other, and having at least one oxygen atom directly bound to the ring in ortho position to one of the side-chains, one side-chain containing, not directly bound to the ring, a carbon atom having three bonds to hetero atoms with at the most one bond to halogen, and the other side-chain having at least one oxygen atom bound in gamma-position to the ring, e.g. prostaglandins

CPC-specific-text.text: by fermentation or enzyme-using processes from marine organisms, e.g. Plexaura Homomalla

note.note-paragraph: Attention is drawn to the definition of steroids in the note following the title of subclass C07J.

In groups C12P33/02 - C12P33/20, the terms "acting", "forming", "hydroxylating", "dehydroxylating" and "dehydrogenating" refer to the action of a microorganism or enzyme rather than other chemical action.

CPC-specific-text.text: Degradation of the lateral chains at position 17

title-part.text: Forming an aryl ring from A ring

reference.text: carbons 13 and 14 belong to the C ring; degradation of lateral chains C12P33/005
reactions are also classified in groups C12P33/00 - C12P33/18

title-part.text: Preparation of compounds having a 5-thia-1-azabicyclo [4.2.0] octane ring system, e.g. cephalosporin
by desacylation of the substituent in the 7 position
by acylation of the substituent in the 7 position
Preparation of compounds having a 4-thia-1-azabicyclo [3.2.0] heptane ring system, e.g. penicillin
in presence of phenylacetic acid or phenylacetamide or their derivatives

CPC-specific-text.text: not to be used

title-part.text: by acylation of the substituent in the 6 position
by desacylation of the substituent in the 6 position
Processes involving microorganisms of different genera in the same process, simultaneously
Processes using enzymes or microorganisms to separate optical isomers from a racemic mixture

CPC-specific-text.text: by metabolizing one of the enantiomers
by oxidation/reduction reactions
by ester formation, lactone formation or the inverse reactions
by esterification of alcohol- or thiol groups in the enantiomers or the inverse reaction
by esterification of carboxylic acid groups in the enantiomers or the inverse reaction
by reactions involving C-N bonds, e.g. nitriles, amides, hydantoins, carbamates, lactames, transamination reactions, or keto group formation from racemic mixtures
by reactions involving acyl derivatives of racemic amines
by reactions involving carbamates
by reactions involving hydantoins or carbamoylamino compounds

title-part.text: Pretreatment of cellulosic or lignocellulosic material for subsequent enzymatic treatment or hydrolysis
Fermentation products obtained from optionally pretreated or hydrolyzed cellulosic or lignocellulosic material as the carbon source
